faqs.question: Ile kosztuje ta nieruchomość?
faqs.answer: €431,000. This 3-bedroom, 2-bathroom apartment offers premium specification at €4,789/m², representing 40% discount versus comparable Spanish island properties. Payment structures include cash purchase, mortgage financing through Spanish lenders, and structured payment plans.

faqs.question: Czy obcokrajowcy mogą kupić nieruchomość w Hiszpanii?
faqs.answer: Yes, absolutely. Non-EU and EU citizens have equal property purchase rights in Spain. No special visa or residency status required for property ownership. Foreign buyers proceed identically to Spanish purchasers, requiring NIE tax identification number and professional legal representation.

faqs.question: Jakie są koszty zakupu nieruchomości w Hiszpanii?
faqs.answer: Purchase costs typically total 8-10% beyond advertised price. Components include: 6-7% transfer tax (Impuesto sobre Transmisiones Patrimoniales), legal fees (0.5-1%), property registration (0.5%), and surveyor costs (0.2-0.5%). Mortgage arrangement costs add 1% if financing required. Budget €34,480-€47,410 in additional costs for this property.

faqs.question: How much rental income can I expect from this apartment?
faqs.answer: Comparable 3-bedroom apartments in Aguilas generate €800+ weekly during peak seasons. Conservative estimates: €800/week × 52 weeks × 65% occupancy = €27,040 annually. Peak season (June-September) achieves higher weekly rates (€900+), while shoulder seasons (April-May, October) command €600-700. Property management companies typically retain 15-20% for marketing, guest screening, and maintenance oversight.

faqs.question: Jakie są koszty życia na Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Cost of living in Aguilas runs 30-40% below UK equivalents. Grocery shopping costs 35-45% less, restaurant meals €8-15 versus UK £12-25, utilities €80-120 monthly, and residential property taxes approximately 0.4% annually. Retirees budget €1,000-1,500 monthly for comfortable living including accommodation, utilities, food, and leisure.

faqs.question: Czy Costa Blanca to dobre miejsce na zakup nieruchomości?
faqs.answer: Yes, Costa Blanca offers strong investment fundamentals for specific buyer profiles. Markets like Benidorm have peaked and face oversupply, but secondary towns like Aguilas demonstrate 8% year-on-year appreciation with stronger rental demand and genuine capital appreciation potential. Strategic location selection separates successful investments from mediocre returns.

faqs.question: What are property taxes in Spain?
faqs.answer: Roczne podatki od nieruchomości (Impuesto sobre Bienes Inmuebles - IBI) calculate at approximately 0.4-0.6% of property value, varying by municipality. This property would incur approximately €1,724-€2,586 annually. Additional considerations include 21% VAT on rental income (if property income declared) and capital gains tax on future appreciation (19% standard rate for residents).

faqs.question: Czy mogę uzyskać kredyt hipoteczny w Hiszpanii jako obcokrajowiec?
faqs.answer: Yes, major Spanish banks extend mortgages to foreign buyers with stable income documentation. Typical requirements include proof of earnings (last 3-6 months), bank statements, identification documents, and NIE tax number. Most banks finance 70-80% of property value to qualified buyers. Interest rates currently range 3.5-4.5% for fixed 20-year terms. Many foreign investors prefer cash purchase eliminating mortgage complexity.

faqs.answer: Flight time from UK airports to Alicante: 2.5-3 hours direct from London, 3-4 hours from regional airports. This property sits 85 kilometers from Alicante Airport (90-minute drive). Ferry options from Portsmouth to Cherbourg provide alternative transport. Established budget airline routes (Ryanair, EasyJet, Vueling) offer frequent connections at competitive pricing, making UK visits convenient for property visits and family vacations.

faqs.question: Jaka jest pogoda na Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Aguilas enjoys 320+ sunshine days annually with mild Mediterranean climate. Summer temperatures peak 30-35°C (86-95°F) June-September with minimal rainfall. Winter temperatures 12-18°C (54-64°F) December-February, perfectly suited for off-season tourism. Spring and autumn offer ideal 20-25°C (68-77°F) conditions. This climate supports year-round holiday let demand, making seasonal income optimization viable.
